so...wow, that was a good hit. Happy 420! :D
it's 4:20am on 4/20!! how exciting !!
This past week completely sucked, for reasons into which I will go later. But it's 4/20, so today is bound to be a great day. Right?

Okay, so, I really, really shouldn't be doing this. Doing what? Writing this shit right now. Not like I ever do, but right now for some reason, right now of all times, I'm writing. I wish I could write for a long time, I'm really in the mood...but I totally have to pack up my stuff. I have sooooo much more shit to pack...I'm sadly moving from Berkeley, my hometown of almost five years now, back to L.A. The Valley. Ugh. I don't know if I will be able to adjust myself to the superficiality that runs through the veins of the city - after living here in Berkeley for so long, I can't stand anything of the sort. Come on dude. You're normal if you are a gutter punk living on the street asking for change for beer and pot. You're normal if you consider Bush and Cheney the true terrorists of the world. You're normal if you have like 20 piercings and pink hair and strip in Tijuana for money so you can buy pills and then get arrested and...oh wait, maybe that's not normal. But...L.A.? You're only normal if you look and act and talk and think just like everyone else, and wear the same clothes, and do the same things, and have money for this and that and other stupid shit. What the fuck am I gonna do dude? I suppose My Mother will want me to slowly assimilate - in fact, she's already made me a hair and nail appointment for when I get down there. Not that that's particularly an L.A. thing, I mean, I know people who do that here (even though I hate her...er, them), but I think it just shows very well how the culture is down there. Fuckin shitass.

Fuck. I feel so...depressed right now. Why? I've been fine all day. Well, I did sleep all day, maybe that's why I was fine. Yes, I went to sleep earlier, and wound up sleeping until about 4:45. Fucking a! When I said earlier that I'd probably get in bed and sleep for 8 more hours, I thought I was joking and exaggerating. But noooo. I guess I have to watch what I say! I really fucking want some ice cream right now. I wish I had some. Maybe I'll drive down the hill and go to Safeway to get some. I think they close at midnight.

It feels really good to close my eyes. I don't exactly feel tired, but I guess I am. I'm trying to decide if I should do some more oxy (I did some like 4 hours ago or something), and right now I'm leaning towards no. It's already late, I'm starting to get tired...I can just save it and do it tomorrow. However, I will smoke a bowl (of course). Sometimes I wonder what my lungs look like, since I smoke so much weed, and I did smoke a bunch of cloves a few years ago, and now I smoke a cigarette now and again. But mainly, the weed. Are they black and dripping with resin? If someone put my lungs in a pipe and smoked it, I bet they'd get really fucking high. Isn't that disgusting? I mean about the smoking lungs part, not the part about getting high from my body parts. That's actually pretty awesome. Now I'm trying to decide again about the oxy. It would be pretty good right now. Bah. I guess I'll do a small line. I just want that taste in the back of my throat. Really, there's no need to be concerned. It would be so much better with a little beer though, I wish we had some beer other than Keystone Light. Yuck. Give me a break! I hate when Ed buys that shit. I like real beer, baby. Fuck, I just dropped the small amount of the 80mg pill of oxy, the last bit I have left. It's dark in here, and the carpet is that weird offwhite-grayish color (the pill is white). How the fuck am I gonna find it? I already have a line sitting here, so that's not the problem - I just don't want it to get smashed into the carpet, or worse, have Jezebel eat it or something. I better get my lighter and get on my knees. Ooh, that kind of sounds erotic. Now I close my eyes again, and I think, what am I doing? Why am I doing oxy, I don't really need it right now. It's already like 3am. No, it's later. Okay, I did it. I did some oxy. Now let me hit this bowl of trainwreck, yo. Mar-i-juana is mmm mmm good. Awesome! I miraculously found the little chunk of oxy without too much effort. Yay. I feel so bloated today, it's kind of gross. I don't really know why, but it could be because I ate, like, a massive amount of food yesterday. Or at least I rememeber yesterday I felt like I did. Who knows. I also watched the movie urlLink JFK yesterday - it was super long, and I felt like nothing really happened in it. But, it was still a good movie. I got my toenails done all nice during it, a nice, shiny red. Very pretty. Soon I'll be able to take pics of these kinds of things and then post them for all to see. :) Maybe it would come up under a foot fetish search. Lol. So yeah! I didn't get to finish earlier. I totally got a place. I'm really happy, but I keep having doubts about it since it's kind of small. But, I am saving money since all utilities are paid. I move in this week...over and over I arrange the place in my head. I wish I could see it again, or I wish I knew the exact measurements or something. I want to go over there again maybe tomorrow or something if they're okay with that, and I'll bring a tape measure. Then I'll know exactly how much space I have to work with. I can't wait to take pictures! Seriously though, I don't know if I'll have enough space for much more than my bed, desk, and a dresser...I'm sure I'll be able to figure something out though. I hope. I mean, I totally have enough stuff to furnish a two bedroom apartment, so I'm really gonna have to pick and choose what I want. Also, I haven't asked about pets, so Jezebel may be an issue - I want to ask about her, but I also don't want to risk losing the place. Even though I know she's not a problem, other people may be weird about rats. I'm also trying to decide which philosophy of feng shui to use. But, I still have some time. I don't think I'll use the compass method, I don't like it. I can't really remember the lighting situation either. Eh well. I'm just so excited! I can't wait to move in. I'll have to decide what posters to put up too. I wish I had money, I'd buy so much new stuff that (I feel like) I need. Especially stuff from IKEA, cute stuff for my new place. Well, shit dawg...I'm getting tired.

What the hell. I was just writing something, then I stupidly clicked on a link and all my shit disappeared. Good thing I had only written like 3-4 lines. Mostly me complaining about...nothing, really. Just complaining. Oh well, I'll just start over. Fuckin' shitass. Yeah, that's right. Fuck-ing shit-ass. It's already after 4pm on Sunday afternoon. What am I doing with myself? I haven't done anything all weekend. I woke up at like 2:45pm or so, and I've pretty much been sitting here at the computer ever since. Well, not the whole time, but just about. I made some tea like an hour ago, and most of it is still sitting here in the mug. I think Jezebel might have actually drank (drunk?) more than I have so far. No no, not really. But she does seem to get way excited about getting to drink my tea. She is so cute. Hey...I got a place! I have my own place!@# I'm so fucking excited, you have no idea. It's the place in Montclair. Or Piedmont, technically.

So I went to the cafe, made it there at like 7:50pm or so (he closes up at 8). He kicked some people out, then made me my drink for there. I love when he does that, it makes me feel cool. I watched him clean up, we chatted, I even did some dishes. I was really high. Then we went out to smoke our ritual cigarette and chatted some more. He asked me a little about smoking weed. I managed to lose track of time, surprise. It was 9pm when I looked at the time, and I was still at the cafe. Fuck. Later,I watched urlLink Zoolander . I heard a bunch of people say it was really funny and pretty good, but I thought it sucked, honestly. A few parts made me laugh, but overall I'd say it wasn't that good. Although, the more fucked up I got during the course of the movie, the funnier it was. That's not necessarily a good thing though. I am so excited to be living alone...maybe I will feel all grown up. Maybe it will help me get my act together and get a fucking job. But no, really, I'm just excited that I'll be more in charge of what I do with my time, and I'll be able to decorate however I want and arrange the furniture however I want and all that jazz. I can feng shui my heart out, with no one sitting there to tell me I'm crazy and wasting my time. I am waiting to hear back from these two studios I applied to. One is in the urlLink Lake Merritt area , in this really cool art deco type building from the 1920s. You walk inside and it's like a hotel, not an apartment building. And the neighborhood is actually pretty nice. The apartment itself isn't bad either - its on the sixth floor, and has a bathroom, a full kitchen, and a good size, uh, area? The part that's not kitchen or bathroom. There's one closet, not too small, but closet space overall is pretty skimpy. The bathroom is pretty cool - there's this whole mirror-vanity thing with little drawers and a little counter and stuff, it's so cute. I still haven't heard back about it though. I'd be taking over this other girl's lease for the next six months. I lied about a job - Veronica said I can say I work for her, so I'd have something to put on the application. I did a credit check on myself yesterday though, and my credit was REALLY bad. It said I was high risk or something. That sucks. All the utilities in this place are paid too, except for phone and cable. Not bad. Supposedly there's no pets allowed, so I don't know what I'd do about Jezebel - sneak her in or ask them about her. But maybe I won't even get it since my credit sucks so bad. Keep your philanges crossed, please. The other place I applied for is an inlaw studio - basically, a room attached to someone's house with a separate entrance. It's in the more upscale Oakland area of urlLink Piedmont , which is actually its own city for some reason. The place is within walking distance to urlLink Montclair Village , the cute little outdoor shopping area with lots of rich white folk and no homeless people or panhandlers. It's all very nice and clean - you'd never guess it was part of the stereotypically ghetto Oaktown. (Seriously, check out the link for Montclair Village, it totally made me laugh. It's a real fucking village!) The studio itself is pretty small actually - I think the ehousing listing said something like 300 sq. ft., but that didn't really help me when I read it, and it still doesn't help me now. It's about the size of an average room. There's no actual kitchen, there's a kitchenette - basically, kitchen stuff built in to one of the walls. There's no bathtub in the bathroom, but the bathroom isn't bad otherwise. There is a TON of closet space, which is really cool. And what's cool is that there's a window that overlooks the bay, and when I exit the studio I'm actually outside looking at the bay on a nice deck with nice landscaping around me. This place is nicer than the Lake Merritt place, but it's smaller, and $45 more a month. A family lives in the house - a husband and a wife, and their two young boys (I think the older one is four years old). I'm a little worried about smoking...but I'm sure everything would be okay. It's about five to seven minutes away from A's house, driving. There's a busstop within walking distance (right in Montclair Village). Their ad also says no pets, but I'm pretty sure they wouldn't mind Jezebel. They really liked me, the mom told me, so hopefully I'll get this place. All utilities are paid here too, including cable. I'm wondering about internet access...I really want dsl. I can't stand cable modem, which I'm using at A's house right now. And, since this place is pretty small, I really wouldn't be able to fit much of my stuff (furniture-wise) into it. That kinda sucks actually. Eh well, we'll see what happens. Hopefully I'll get at least one of the two!
Snorting more oxy. Smoking more weed. Playing more minesweeper. Fuck expert level, I suck at it.

LA, Part II So I drove for a few hours, and a few hours more. It was a full moon that night, Friday the 13th. I kept having bad feelings, but I do tend to be a bit superstitious occasionally. I just really felt like I was making a really bad decision. But I just kept remembering something my mother had said to me earlier that day - think of the trip to LA as a several week long vacation, something to let me know where I really wanted to be. I may still miss Berkeley in a few weeks, or I may be fine in LA, we could just wait and see. I knew I wouldn't be fine... I arrived in LA around 1:30am if I remember correctly. I was super tired - I had only gotten like a total of 5 hours of sleep the previous two nights combined, added to way more physical labor than I was used to (which is...um, none), the labor that comes with moving large boxes filled with massive amounts of shit (not literal shit, of course). I had to wake up at around 7am that day if I wanted to get to the testing site on time, which I did. I went inside my parents' house, found my stepfather passed out on the couch and my brother awake in his room playing computer games. Nothing seems to have changed since I was here last, or the time before that, or the time before that.... My disassembled computer was sitting in the back seat of the rental. Given the fact that the crime rate has been steadily increasing in the valley the past few years, and just my better judgement, I didn't want to leave my shit in the car. I started to slowly bring in piece by piece of my computer, and recruited my brother to help. Keep in mind he's only 12, so he isn't really big enough to carry lots of shit at once. But, he helps with what he can. As we were walking in from outside at some point, my brother accidentally let the screen door slam, which woke up my stepdad who was until that point still passed out on the couch. He was all incoherent and angry, and started yelling at me for "waking everyone up" and "what am I doing coming so late" and "why am I bringing all my shit in, I'm just keeping everyone up," and...I could go on, as one could imagine. I explained I didn't want to leave my computer in the car overnight, that I would just bring it in and get the rest of the stuff tomorrow. He said that was stupid and I should just leave it and go to bed. He even followed me outside and was yelling at me in the street. It was kind of embarassing, and just reaffirmed my feelings that I was making a huge mistake. All his yelling woke up my mom, who came down all groggy and confused from upstairs. What's going on? she asked. Wayne just started yelling, and she said of course I should get my computer, is he crazy? She calmed him down, then bitched at me a bit for "being incosiderate" and whatnot, but I could tell she was just yelling at me to appease him. She actually did a good job of mediating that night. So this whole time Jezebel was in the car. I cleared some space with my brother on top of his dresser for her cage, the same place we kept the cage last December when I went home for krismas. I brought her inside - her cage was the last thing coming in for the night. When Wayne saw me coming inside with her, he started yelling again immediately. He was telling me some bullshit like she needs to stay outside in the garage or on the patio, and I was saying that was ridiculous. I knew some ghetto street rat would get in her cage and rape her. Rats don't belong in bedrooms, he yelled. Wtf, I was thinking. Why couldn't you tell me this before the moment I get here? I asked. It doesn't matter, the rat isn't staying in the house. Why? Because I said so. Well, give me a reason. Because I said so. I'm bringing her inside until you give me a reason. You better not bring her inside. I'm putting her down so I can at least shut the door. What are you doing? I said don't bring the rat inside. I'm shutting the door, you don't want me to leave it open do you?? Here comes my mom down the stairs. What's the problem? she asked. Wayne won't let me keep Jezebel inside. Wayne, why not? Rats don't belong inside, and there's no room in Michael's room. Oh, but I made room, I said. No, there's no room, you couldn't have. Well, I did, me and Mike. He doesn't care, he said it's fine. Put the rat in the kitchen, he said. You want the rat in the kitchen? Isn't that worse than keeping a rat in the bedroom? That doesn't even make sense to me, I said. Rats are nocturnal and it will keep Michael up all night, you can't keep it in the bedroom. She's not that loud, if there's a problem, we can deal with it later, it's 2am. Wayne, just let her put the rat in the bedroom, we'll deal with this later. So Jezebel got to stay in the bedroom, with me. Yay. I must have the most difficult, ridiculous parents ever. Or at least it seems that way, all too often. I got in bed, looked over my CBEST book, and set my alarm for 7am. I actually got another 3 hours of sleep that night, I think. And I still managed to do great on my test the next day. Go me. And so ends the day of arrival.

Well now. It's been awhile since I've written anything, but, here I am in full force. I'm really fucked up right now - is that a surprise? It shouldn't be. I've grown up a lot in the past month or so. As I mentioned in my last post, I packed up all my shit (well, most of it...what I didn't pack up and bring with me I put into a storage locker I rented) and moved down to LA. Where do I even begin with the LA experience? There's so much to talk about. Friday, June 13th (bad luck already - I should have realized the bad omen), I got my rental car, packed the shit I was taking with me into the car, and set off, leaving my Berkeley days behind me. I was terribly upset - I couldn't stop crying all day. I wouldn't have left that day except I had to take the CBEST the following day down in the valley. On my way out of town, I stopped for one last double vanilla iced latte at Fertile Grounds, made by the owner, Ayman. I knew I'd really miss him - we'd always had a fun, flirty rapport. Plus, I have the biggest crush on him. On the way there I almost got into an accident - yes, it's only a block and a half away from my old apartment complex, but hey now, I was dazed. Everything was fine though. Then as I parked, I witnessed an accident in the intersection directly in front of me. Freaky, I thought. But, in any case, I got my latte, and walked back to the car while wiping away tears. I really didn't want to leave. When I got into the car, I proceeded to immediately spill a portion of my latte all over myself, my purse, and the rental car seats. Great. I'd have to go back into the cafe and clean myself off and get some napkins for the car seat. So I walked back in, which I'm sure was weird to Ayman. I told him what happened, and he gave me some paper towels. As I was trying to wipe off my purse, my glass chillum fell out onto the cement floor, shattering into a million pieces for all to see. I was so fucking embarassed. At first Ayman didn't notice, but when he did, he came out with a broom and asked if it was my pipe that broke. I told him yes, and he replied that it was a good thing. That's when I left for real, and started crying, although I can't say which happened first.

Why do I feel so fucking tired? I think I'm getting sick or something. Boy, I have so much to say. Pass that dutch. But will I really say anything at all? My left hand is hurting for some reason - not really my hand, but more like the bottom of my ring and middle fingers. I don't know what the fuck is going on, but it sucks. I wonder if I will ever be censored for anything I write in here, or have my shit removed. You know, for like, talking about drugs and whatnot. Whoa! Drugs are cool. I seriously wish more than anything that I would fucking get up and clean my room. Why the lack of motivation? Could it be the pot? No. Really I think it isn't. Some kind of psychological block or something preventing me from cleaning. My room is a complete disaster though, shouldn't that be enough motivation? One would think so. Not me, though. I'm hella lit.

My neck hurts so much. :( If I was rich I would go see my chiropractor 1-2 times a week like I used to and also go see a masseuse. I'm so tense and tight for some reason. It sucks ass dude, being in pain all the time. And I'm only 23. Although lately everytime I look in the mirror I feel like I'm about 34. I'm getting high. Let me take another hit right now and I'll report the results.

More thunder and lightning! Yay! This is so cool. And I still haven't even gotten high yet. I should post after I take each hit. I know I'm posting a lot today/right now. Maybe I'm making up for lost time. Maybe I'm just in a crazy mood. Maybe both. Maybe I want to get high. Well, duh, of course I do. What am I listening to? The Toadies. Remember the Toadies? Hehe. Do you wanna be my angel?

Ok I totally thought an earthquake was about to start. Turns out it was just really loud thunder. How awesome! We never get thunderstorms. I remember when I was a little girl and I used to stay with my grandparents out on Long Island for the summer, I loved it when there were huge thunderstorms. My Nana would always come wake me up if it happened to be the middle of the night, and the power would go out and we would watch the sky flicker and listen to the house shake. It was so much fun. I hope my power doesn't go out now, I just thought about that. What a motherfucking crazy storm this is right now. My windows are hella rattling. This is so awesome. My weather report looks like this: showers, showers, showers, showers, showers, showers...times like 37 or some shit like that. And I totally have to open the store tomorrow at 9, which means leave house at like 7:10am...ugh. Plus I left my umbrella at work. Maybe I will just call a cab tomorrow igga. This morning walking to the bus stop in the pouring rain was fucking hell dude. It was like walking in a river. But it wasn't so bad really, I just got super stoned and like, separated my mind from my body during that time. I must have, it's the only way I could have dealt with that shit. Being rained on and all that. Praise the almighty jesus for my marijuana.

I am so fucking cold dawg. I have so much to write about, if i so desired...I suppose I would need to use my discretion to decide what exactly I want to write, what I want "out there." It's like once I formulate thoughts and feelings into actual words - and write them down somewhere, no less - it just makes them that much more concrete. If I wanted to say that I was wrong or mistaken and I never thought or felt a certain way, now I can't. Putting shit out there makes it harder to deny later. And plus there's less mystery. Does that even make sense? I sound like a crackhead, and I haven't even hit my pipe yet. No, not my crack pipe. I don't even have one of those. I mean my mari-ja-wana pipe. I haven't hit my pipe since earlier, with Krislyn. What a crazy cat that chick is.

Man. I totally just woke up, at like, 5:30. Yes, pm. And my alarm was set for 11:30am. And yes, I was indeed hitting snooze every nine minutes between 11:30am and 5:30pm. Can you believe that? I can, it's not really all that out of the ordinary. But I really didn't want to wake up so late, I kind of wanted to get up at a reasonable hour and be productive. You know, clean my room, run some errands, shit like that. I really want to see Kill Bill Vol. 2. I was supposed to go yesterday with some friends, but it was sold out everywhere by the time we tried to buy tickets at like, noon. That sucked. So I'm thinking maybe tonight I'll go to Tim and Patrick's and watch Volume 1. I'd still rather go see Vol. 2, but it will be good to refresh my memory I guess, right? Okay, shower time. I wish I had a lot of drugs.

I'm eating lasagna with a spoon. I'm not quite sure I've actually done this before, but I don't have any more clean forks and I'm definitely not about to wash one. No way dawg. I'm listening to the streaming video from msnbc.com - all the shit going on with 9/11 and Ashcroft and the FBI and Iraq and hostages and oh who else can we blame and drag into this and it will never end, never ever. Congratulations, you're watching the beginning of WWIII. I just finished my lasagna. I'm pretty high. I've been smoking pretty steadily for the past few hours. I just took this personality disorder test. Here are my results: Disorder Rating urlLink Paranoid : Low urlLink Schizoid : Low urlLink Schizotypal : Moderate urlLink Antisocial : Low urlLink Borderline : Low urlLink Histrionic : Moderate urlLink Narcissistic : Moderate urlLink Avoidant : High urlLink Dependent : High urlLink Obsessive-Compulsive : High -- urlLink Personality Disorder Test - Take It! -- Look how bright and red that last one is...obsessive compulsive. Hell, I could have told you that. Actually I already did. Avoidant and dependent though, that's interesting. Obsessive-Compulsive Obsessive-Compulsive personality disorder is similar to obsessive-compulsive anxiety disorder. People with this disorder are overly focused on orderliness and perfection. Their need to do everything "right" often interferes with their productivity. They tend to get caught up in the details and miss the bigger picture. They set unreasonably high standards for themselves and others, and tend to be very critical of others when they do not live up to these high standards. They avoid working in teams, believing others to be too careless or incompetent. They avoid making decisions because they fear making mistakes and are rarely generous with their time or money. They often have difficulty expressing emotion. Avoidant Avoidant personality disorder is characterized by extreme social anxiety. People with this disorder often feel inadequate, avoid social situations, and seek out jobs with little contact with others. They are fearful of being rejected and worry about embarassing themselves in front of others. They exaggerate the potential difficulties of new situations to rationalize avoiding them. Often, they will create fantasy worlds to substitute for the real one. Unlike schizoid personality disorder, avoidant people yearn for social relations yet feel they are unable to obtain them. They are frequently depressed and have low self-confidence. Dependent Dependent personality disorder is characterized by a need to be taken care of. People with this disorder tend to cling to people and fear losing them. They may become suicidal when a break-up is imminent. They tend to let others make important decisions for them and often jump from relationship to relationship. They often remain in abusive relationships. They are overly sensitive to disapproval. They often feel helpless and depressed. Okay, honestly, I agree with the obsessive-compulsive disorder part. I might be moderatlely avoidant and dependent, but nowhere near the extremes described here. Another interesting thing I realized while taking this test is how much I have changed over that last few months. A lot of the questions where I would have given one answer a few months ago totally don't fit me anymore. Like the ones asking if I'm scared of being alone. Was I at some point? Yes, definitely. Am I now? Definitely not. Shit like that. I guess that's cool. It's like I've become more sure of myself and my ability to take care of myself.

urlLink Bush Takes Tumble During Bicycle Ride (you might have to register to read anything on this website, so I'll paste the article at the end of my post) I'm sorry but this is extremely amusing to me. Read the entire thing, it's pretty short. Seems like Bush is a bit of a bumbling idiot, eh? But hey, check out that part about John Kerry falling while snowboarding. They should use that in ads to get young people to vote for him and get Bush out of the White House. Bush Takes Tumble During Bicycle Ride President Unhurt, Completes Course By Dana Milbank Washington Post Staff Writer Sunday, May 23, 2004; Page A10 AUSTIN, May 22 -- President Bush, always a bit star-crossed in his leisure pursuits, suffered a new misadventure in athleticism Saturday when he fell off a bicycle. The president was in mile 16 of a 17-mile course on his ranch in Crawford, Tex., when he fell from a mountain bike, suffering scrapes and scratches on his chin, upper lip, nose, right hand and both knees. But, true to form, Bush stayed the course: After getting cleaned up by the White House doctor, he completed his bike ride. Trent Duffy, a White House spokesman, immediately offered excuses for his boss. "It's been raining a lot, and the topsoil is loose," he said. In addition, Duffy reasoned, "He likes to go all out. Suffice it to say he wasn't whistling show tunes." Fortunately, Duffy reported, Bush was wearing a helmet and mouth guard. The spokesman warned that Bush probably would be wearing a bandage on his chin when he arrived here Saturday night for a party for his daughter Jenna, who is graduating from the University of Texas this weekend. For the president, there is something of a history of hapless encounters with sporting activities. Years of running gave him two bum knees that have periodically left him limping his way to Air Force One. In December, doctors at Walter Reed Army Medical Center examined him with X-rays and magnetic resonance imaging and, finding some damage to both knees, recommended "cross training." In other words, exercise such as mountain biking. In January 2002, Bush was on the third floor of the White House residence, watching a football playoff game between the Baltimore Ravens and Miami Dolphins when he choked on a pretzel. This caused him to faint and fall, bruising and scraping his face. Bush was accompanied only by dogs Spot and Barney. Then, in June 2003, Bush was visiting his parents at the family compound in Kennebunkport, Maine, when he fell from a motorized Segway scooter. Bush, who was holding a tennis racket that may have interfered with his coordination, did not hurt himself -- but the incident was captured by photographers and quickly beamed across the world. Athletic miscues are a bipartisan affair, of course. Bush's Democratic challenger John F. Kerry has, during the current campaign, fallen off a bicycle and taken a nasty spill while snowboarding. He blamed the Secret Service for the latter. Bush's close calls predate his ascension to the presidency. During the campaign in 1999, he scraped his right leg and hip when a truck trailer overturned near his jogging path in Austin. Bush dived for cover when chunks of concrete and wood were dumped behind him. Around the same time, Bush went swimming in the pond on his ranch with his advertising strategist when the two men spotted cottonmouth water moccasins -- the only type of poisonous water snake in North America. That time, at least, Bush was not snakebit. © 2004 The Washington Post Company

Thank god I have the day off - I worked six days in a row before today. And let me tell you, that sucked. Working retail that many days in a row, I start to hate people, hate their questions, hate their comments, their clothes, their attitudes...but I still love their money. I wish I could just take all their money. And oh do I try. I'm trying to decide what to do right now. My choices are shower, sit here and fuck around on the computer, sit here and do something other than fuck around on the computer, or maybe not sit here but not shower and instead clean my room or something. And my room really, really needs to be cleaned. I don't know what it is with me. I have some kind of aversion to cleaning my room. More than most people. It's not like I just don't like cleaning, because I do...I think there's some kind of psychological issue going on here. I tried bringing it up in therapy like 2 weeks ago but I wasn't really sure how to explain myself. But she definitely agreed it's the opposite end of the OCD (obsessive-compulsive disorder) spectrum from where I used to be. Ah, the brain. How much fun you are to deal with sometimes. I think I'm going to hit my pipe and see what happens and where I end up.

So here I am, yet again. Up way too late, yet again. It's times like these when I think to myself, what the fuck am I doing with my life? Do I have any direction whatsoever? Then I usually hit my pipe if it's around to shut those voices up. No seriously, I am worried about myself. How the fuck is it already almost June of 2004? Why the fuck am I still working at a retail job I took "temporarily" last August? I mean sure I've been promoted a few times and now I'm assistant manager, so I guess that's a reference at least. Right? Sigh. Where's my pipe? A friend suggested to me (a few times now) that I volunteer as a counselor and work with troubled kids or something. That would let me work with people and help them, and plus it might help me get into grad school. Which is totally what I want to do at this point, but I feel like I wouldn't have the best application. Yeah, I know I'd be great for whoever wants me, but how the fuck am I supposed to prove that within the narrow guidelines they use for choosing people? Someone else might look better on paper, when I know I'm better. Or am I? Of course I am. I guess I have some kind of direction. Grad school, straight ahead. I feel like there's so many little pieces of my life that I have to take care of before I even decide on a direction. Maybe that's just how I fool myself into thinking everything's okay and I can be immobile forever. I don't want to grow up. Maybe people feel like that their entire lives, that there are so many things that need to be taken care of before they can move forward in their lives. Maybe not. I guess I need to just go forward - as in, decide what I want to do with myself and then start going towards that - and take care of all the little pieces along the way, instead of just pausing everything. But seriously, I think I needed some time to regroup and collect my life and thoughts and everything and take a break from everything. Decide what I want to do with myself right now and in the future. Obviously I don't want to do retail my entire life. I'm better than that, and besides that, retail sucks. I would, however, own a business. And I would definitely not run it the way the owners of the company I work for run theirs. Let's just leave it at that. Okay, so what do I want to do? Go to grad school. Pay my outstanding bills. Maintain my intelligence and sanity. That was a long flow of thought...one which flows through my mind every day at least a few times. I don't even know if it made sense. Wow I have so much to talk about.

I am really fucking high right now. What a beautiful day boys and girls! After getting really depressed last night, I went to bed around 11:30. The depression mixed with the sedatives I had snorted made me pretty sleepy I suppose, and besides that I just didn't want to be awake any longer. After being excited all week about A coming home, the incredible letdown that occurred just made me want to end the day as soon as possible. I knew he was coming home last night, and I was totally planning on seeing him (of course). He called me at around 8pm or so to say "hey, just left San Francisco so they shouldn't be here for about 30 minutes, and C [his friend who he went on the trip with] is in the shower, so I have a little time to see you." I was completely insulted at this - I'm not important enough to have my own time? I have to be hidden from his "real friends" and squeezed in miniature time slots between his other plans? Fuck that dude. I told him no, I didn't want to see him like that, it made me feel really shitty and unimportant. (This is weird btw, since I usually let him walk all over me.) I wanted to see him when I wouldn't have a ten minute time limit and he wouldn't have to rush out and pretend he wasn't just with me. "What the fuck?? I'm offering to come see your ass and you're going to bitch about it? Fuck that. You know what? Fuck you!" I'm sure he continued along those lines, but at that point I hung up. Fuck him for talking to me like that - I did absolutely nothing to warrant that kind of response, and I'm not going to sit on the phone and listen to him behave like that. Besides that, I didn't even say anything wrong, it seems pretty logical to me. He was apparently extremely offended that I didn't want to drop everything and see him for seven minutes and 23 seconds. So, I did some random stuff around my place and went to bed. I cried and cried, and eventually fell asleep.

So I have been retaking these enneagram quizzes at various times for a few reasons - it was recommended to take the tests at least several times and see what you get the most and what is most accurate, as your mood may be different at different times, thereby affecting your answers. Makes sense, right? The one you get the most should be the most accurate for the test taker. Here are my results so far: First: Conscious self
ENTP - "Inventor". Enthusiastic interest in everything and always sensitive to possibilities. Non-conformist and innovative. 3.2% of the total population.
INTP - "Architect". Greatest precision in thought and language. Can readily discern contradictions and inconsistencies. The world exists primarily to be understood. 3.3% of total population.

I finally got out of bed at around 2pm. I had set my alarm for 11am, hoping to not sleep all day like I usually do on my days off, and besides that I knew I was supposed to be in Berkeley for therapy at 3:30. I wanted to get up and be productive...after all, that is my 'thing' - being productive. Maybe that's because I feel in general that I am entirely too unproductive. Anyways, I woke up at 10 and called my friend to talk about some random shit, and then wound up going back to sleep until I got up at 2. I hit snooze about 5 billion times just like every other day - quite honestly, I'm suprised I haven't smashed my alarm clock to pieces in my sleep yet. I took a shower which ended up being about 37 minutes (haha, "about," you know I totally looked at the clock) - and that was with me trying to not take too long. Damn. I realized there was no way I could be in Berkeley for my appointment anywhere near 3:30, so I called and left a message saying I missed my bus and I was really sorry but I couldn't make it. I dried my hair, put on some moisturizer, threw on some little shorts that I wear around the house, and now here I am. I'm smoking my first bowl of the day, and already I am completely stoned. When you smoke as much as I do, it's not really a matter of getting high anymore, it's more like, "what can I do to maintain my constant high?" Waking up and then smoking doesn't just get me really high, I feel like it actually renews my level of high-ness from at least the night before. It reactivates the high levels of THC flowing through my body already - so, instead of me feeling like I just took 3 hits from my bowl, I feel like I've been smoking for awhile and the few hits I just took are just added to that. Wow, I'm really high. And this Dr. Pepper isn't helping. I feel like I can hardly think. I have some dumb little errands I have to run, and then some not as dumb shit I need to take care of, but I usually put that kind of shit off. Maybe I should get dressed and put on some makeup, yes? Fuck. What to do.
My fucking internet is back up. I've been way too productive the past few days...at last, something to distract me!

So today at work this guy came in asking for some semipermanent blond toner. I was really the only one there who knew anything about what he was talking about, so I walked with him to show him where it is in the store. I got this weird feeling from him, but I attributed it to me being incredibly stoned. But, whatever, most guys probably feel weird coming into a beauty salon, I figured. Then he started saying how much he liked my hair, and he even touched it at one point when talking about what color he wanted his hair. "You have really nice hair," he said. "Oh, thanks." I know I have nice hair, silly, silly boy. I wasn't exactly sure about the instructions for what he was getting since his hair was already bleached, but I tried to help him the best I could. I hoped I wasn't telling him to do something that would make his hair fall out or fuck anything up, but I was pretty confident I wasn't. There were a billion people in the store, he waited in line, I rung him up, and then he left. A couple hours later, the store phone rings. My coworker who answered the phone told me that someone I helped earlier was on the phone for me; I was silently hoping he didn't go home and follow my instructions and then all his hair fell out. Of course, it was nothing like that. "Hi, I'm Roberto, you helped me earlier, what's your name?" So I told him, and then he was like "well I really think you're beautiful and I'd really like to get to know you better, maybe I can give you my number and we can go out and get a drink sometime." Alright, I said. It's not like I couldn't just take his number from him over the phone and then throw it away or something. And plus, he went through the trouble of looking up the store number and calling back and asking for me. On the phone he said something about really wanting to ask while he was there, but there were too many people and he was nervous or something. Sometimes I feel like I have some stranger power of attraction that either attracts complete stalkers/weirdos, or just causes people to behave as such. Or just that weird things happen to me pretty consistently. That's just how my days normally go though...

Today seemed like a long day, although I guess it wasn't that bad. I had to be at work at quarter to 9 to open the store in the morning, and since I slept at A's last night (yes, there is definitely a correlation between the amount of time I spend over there and how often I post), I had him drop me off at my coworker's since we were opening together. The manager and I were supposed to have an interview with some girl at 11, but she never showed up. Bitch. One of the registers broke, but then our other coworker brought In-N-Out, so that made things seem a little better. The manager and I hung up some random pictures in the bathroom (one of our favorite things to do is take weird pictures when we're supposed to be working). I left early to go to therapy, so that was cool, and then I took the bus home. No one tried to sell me any weed today! I guess that's good, I hate being bothered. And of course I'm not going to buy some dumb weed off some dumb guy on the street. Duh. It's funny, I don't even look like a typical stoner. Most of the time at least. All this talking about weed is making me realize I haven't smoked all day...I should pack a bowl! Yay. My room is a fucking mess. I need to clean it, but the idea of that is just so unappealing to me. Okay, I'm going to try to motivate myself. Perhaps I should offer myself a reward. Any suggestions?

Today wasn't a bad day. I was going to go to Express to get some new clothes, but instead I went to Orchard to buy some plants and soil. When I got home, I got really high (maybe I should just say higher) and potted my new plants. Yay! Now I'm making rice-a-roni. It smells so good. I'm super hungry...

I'm the naked one, not the drugs. But I am doing drugs, naked. Yay! I love taking showers when I'm really high! I know I've been mia lately...I have SO much to write about! Among them, my birthday...sigh. Another year older. All of a sudden I feel so much older, being 24 instead of 23. I mean, of course I'm the same from one day to the next, but really I am trying to be a little bit more responsible...a little bit.

urlLink ExtraTV.com : Moore and Stern Take On Bush [btw, I'm totally annoyed at blogger right now, it seems like I keep posting things, and then when it comes time to publish them, I get that dumb page that says the page can't be loaded, and then my whole entry is lost. What happened to any sense of stability? I'm mad that my entries keep getting lost...] He's likely to become one of the most influential men in American politics -- and he's not even a politician. Michael Moore's scathing anti-Bush film, "Fahrenheit 9/11," has earned more than $60 million at the box office, and Time magazine made Moore this week's cover boy. According to Time Senior Writer Richard Lacayo, Moore's movie could potentially cost Bush a second term in the White House. "Moore's been able to make this film very quickly and drop it right into the most potent moment in the election season," Lacayo insisted. "Fahrenheit 9/11" paints the president as incompetent and uncovers Bush family connections to the powerful Bin Laden family. Meanwhile, the Bush camp has called Moore's film a "pack of lies." But in attempt to be fair, Moore set up a "Fahrenheit war room" to deal with the accusations of inaccuracies. Moore has even employed former Clinton administration officials to deal with the media blitz. But it seems that the director has got a new best friend in his mission to remove Bush from office -- radio icon Howard Stern. Stern has been on a daily radio rant against the Bush administration, saying he's been unfairly targeted by the FCC for indecency. So could a Stern/Moore team be enough to get the president out? Lacayo told us it's amazing how much these two could sway the election by working together: "Taken together, Michael Moore and Howard Stern are both at the top of their industries: radio and film. They both have an enormous audience, and together, they'll be punching away until Election Day." With four months until the election, there's still plenty of time for campaigning and plenty of time for America's newest power couple to make an impact. Meanwhile, Moore is already eying his next target; he will focus on HMOs and the healthcare system in his next documentary.
